--- title: matplotlib demo format: html: code-fold: true --- For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see @fig-polar. ::: {#cell-fig-polar .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} import numpy as np import matplotlib.pyplot as plt r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01) theta = 2 * np.pi * r fig, ax = plt.subplots( subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} ) ax.plot(theta, r) ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2]) ax.grid(True) plt.show() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![A line plot on a polar axis](pedo_files/figure-html/fig-polar-output-1.png){#fig-polar width=450 height=439} ::: ::: ::: {#exr-un-problema} # Problema dificil Esta es una pregunta dificil ::: ::: {#sol-un-problema} Esta es la solución al problema anterior ::: ::: {#exr-otro} # Problema dificil Esta es una pregunta dificil ::: ::: {#sol-otro} Esta es la solución al problema anterior ::: Ver el @exr-un-problema Ver el @exr-otro ::: {.details} Algo que se oculta ::: ```{=html}
System Requirements

Requires a computer running an operating system. The computer must have some memory and ideally some kind of long-term storage. An input device as well as some form of output device is recommended.

System Requirements

Requires a computer running an operating system. The computer must have some memory and ideally some kind of long-term storage. An input device as well as some form of output device is recommended.

``` ::: {#exr-} # Problema facil Esta es una pregunta dificil :::
